title: How to Use Pines

steps.headline: Use the pine needles from a pine tree to make tea.
steps.description: Pine needle tea has up to five times more vitamin C than a lemon by weight. This tea has a unique minty, sweet taste to it. It is made simply by adding some pine needles to hot water. Do not consume it if you are pregnant or breast feeding.

steps.headline: When you are sweeping up pine needles, use the pine needles for gardening.
steps.description: They can be used as a pest controller or as fertilizers.

steps.headline: Use pine needles as sachet-fresheners.
steps.description: They are great to use as an air freshener inside a simple sachet. Or, they can be used simply as a decoration or even added to potpourri.

steps.headline: Learn how to make scented pine cones.
steps.description: These cones make a great room-freshener or decoration for your house or Christmas tree. The fragrance can be varied according to the amount and type of aroma you use.

steps.headline: Learn how to make neon pine cone card holders.
steps.description: These pine cone holders add a decorative touch to any table setting. By adding a neon dash onto a pine cone, it'll be one craft everyone wants to know how to make.

steps.headline: Use pine cones for the birds.
steps.description: Turn the pine cones into peanut butter pine cones. They are really easy to make. See how many birds you can attract! They can be hung anywhere except inside your home (as, clearly, the birds aren't inside).

steps.headline: If you want to keep your pine cones long lasting why not preserve them?
steps.description: It'll make them looking fresh for a very long time so get creative!

steps.headline: Make a pine cone centerpiece.
steps.description: Although old-fashioned, this decoration will bring love and joy for your traditional holiday fun.

steps.headline: Instead of using just the pine tree for a Christmas tree, why not add in a twist and make the tree out of cones?
steps.description: It is much more compact and great to put on a table when serving your Christmas dinner.

steps.headline: For a great Christmas tree, there's nothing like making pine cone ornaments.
If you really have no idea what to use pine cones for, why not just let them serve as simple decorations?
Find the seeds from the pine tree in the cone.
steps.description: These seeds are also referred to 'nuts'. They can be easily roasted and are a delicious treat which are rich in monounsaturated fat. Since they are high in natural oils, they can be used for pesto sauces or by roasting. They vary in sizes and shape and may needed to be shelled.

steps.headline: Make pignoli cookies.
steps.description: This cookie is a staple cookie in Italy; it tastes sensational. Just by adding some pine nuts, eggs, sugar and almond paste, this recipe is a good way to use pine nuts.

steps.headline: Make a delicious pine nut sundae.
steps.description: The texture is creamy and tasty.

steps.headline: Since the nuts are perfect for pesto, why not actually make pesto?
steps.description: This gourmet recipe will and always be addictive.

text: Using Pine Needles Use the pine needles from a pine tree to make tea. Pine needle tea has up to five times more vitamin C than a lemon by weight. This tea has a unique minty, sweet taste to it. It is made simply by adding some pine needles to hot water. Do not consume it if you are pregnant or breast feeding. When you are sweeping up pine needles, use the pine needles for gardening. They can be used as a pest controller or as fertilizers. Use pine needles as sachet-fresheners. They are great to use as an air freshener inside a simple sachet. Or, they can be used simply as a decoration or even added to potpourri. Using Pine Cones Learn how to make scented pine cones. These cones make a great room-freshener or decoration for your house or Christmas tree. The fragrance can be varied according to the amount and type of aroma you use. Learn how to make neon pine cone card holders. These pine cone holders add a decorative touch to any table setting. By adding a neon dash onto a pine cone, it'll be one craft everyone wants to know how to make. Use pine cones for the birds. Turn the pine cones into peanut butter pine cones. They are really easy to make. See how many birds you can attract! They can be hung anywhere except inside your home (as, clearly, the birds aren't inside). If you want to keep your pine cones long lasting why not preserve them? It'll make them looking fresh for a very long time so get creative! Make a pine cone centerpiece. Although old-fashioned, this decoration will bring love and joy for your traditional holiday fun. Instead of using just the pine tree for a Christmas tree, why not add in a twist and make the tree out of cones? It is much more compact and great to put on a table when serving your Christmas dinner. For a great Christmas tree, there's nothing like making pine cone ornaments. They are wonderful. If you really have no idea what to use pine cones for, why not just let them serve as simple decorations? They are great to paint! Using Pine Nuts Find the seeds from the pine tree in the cone. These seeds are also referred to 'nuts'. They can be easily roasted and are a delicious treat which are rich in monounsaturated fat. Since they are high in natural oils, they can be used for pesto sauces or by roasting. They vary in sizes and shape and may needed to be shelled. Make pignoli cookies. This cookie is a staple cookie in Italy; it tastes sensational. Just by adding some pine nuts, eggs, sugar and almond paste, this recipe is a good way to use pine nuts. Make a delicious pine nut sundae. The texture is creamy and tasty. Since the nuts are perfect for pesto, why not actually make pesto? This gourmet recipe will and always be addictive.
